reviewText: I don't know if a nurse movie is a genre in itself, or only something Roger Corman makes. These movies collected here are suppose to be cult classics, but I don't know what all the fuss is about. These movies aren't really that entertaining, but I think there's some formula to a nurse movie. Which sort of make all these movies similar, since they're all nurse movies. I learned nudity was a prerequisite, and that was the main reason I bought these movies, hoping to see young nurses nude. But I think the movies are a keeper.
summary: I'm Not Sure What Makes A Nurse Movie
Title: Roger Corman's Cult Classics: The Nurses Collection (Candy Stripe Nurses, Private Duty Nurses, Night Call Nurses, Young Nurses)

reviewText: Was really young; since I'm now old; since I saw and enjoyed these dumb films. But who knew that 30+ years later they would show up on DVD. Thanks for the memories. Came fast and package right.
Title: Roger Corman's Cult Classics: The Nurses Collection (Candy Stripe Nurses, Private Duty Nurses, Night Call Nurses, Young Nurses)

reviewText: Not lighthearted, playful or funny or whacky as expected.Often on the twisted and abusive side with few revealing sexual scenes, but cute well figured girls -  Plots bland and mostly disconnected with being a nurse.
summary: People with problems  - Mostly sad soap with few highlights
Title: Roger Corman's Cult Classics: The Nurses Collection (Candy Stripe Nurses, Private Duty Nurses, Night Call Nurses, Young Nurses)

reviewText: Have been a fan of exploitation film from the '70s for many years (my fav being The Women in Prison flicks) and was thinking upon hearing of this release that I have died and gone to drive-in heaven! These four nurse films are classics of exploitation in my book. This two DVD set has two films per disc in anamorphic widescreen for the first time! The only down side to this set (which is why I gave it four stars) is the lack of special features. There are two. That is it! One is an interview with Roger and Julie Corman (the best special feature I have seen in years) and the other is with the two directors of Night Call Nurses and Candy Stripe Nurses (it is cool to see Jonathan Kaplan remember making his flick). With the status of these four classic films where are the trailers!? And I would love to hear Jonathan Kaplan for eighty minutes talking about his bout with exploitation cinema. But NO ONE can look or sound as excited as the great Roger Corman! Man, I could listen to him talk for days about his cheap filmmaking techniques.I am VERY disappointed that Stephanie Rothman's (one great female director under the Corman belt) The Student Nurses was not included with this set. Preferred to have ALL the nurse films in one set! But that one quibble aside, this still is great to have if you are a fan of sleazy drive-in fare from the '70s. These are great looking transfers that are bright and colorful compared to the terrible DVD releases from the past.Now the question lies, Where are The Teacher films at? Come on, you got me hungry for more... The Student Teachers and Summer School Teachers I know need the love and care these Nurse films got. One can only cross his fingers and hope that they too (along with Student Nurses) gets a DVD release in the future.More reason to love Shout and the great work they keep giving us fans!
summary: This is one nice package!! I mean the movies...they are in great condition!
Title: Roger Corman's Cult Classics: The Nurses Collection (Candy Stripe Nurses, Private Duty Nurses, Night Call Nurses, Young Nurses)

reviewText: If you like Roger Corman movies this will be up your alley. The plots on all 4 movies are good. Not great but good. The girls are SEXY as expected of a Roger Corman movie. The movie quality as expected is Drive-in move style. I like the movies and I think they are a good buy.
summary: Star rated for a Roger Corman movie
Title: Roger Corman's Cult Classics: The Nurses Collection (Candy Stripe Nurses, Private Duty Nurses, Night Call Nurses, Young Nurses)

reviewText: This came on time and in very good condition. What the movies were about I really don't remember but it was at a great price so it's okay.
summary: Roger Corman's Cult Classics: The Nurses Collection
Title: Roger Corman's Cult Classics: The Nurses Collection (Candy Stripe Nurses, Private Duty Nurses, Night Call Nurses, Young Nurses)

reviewText: Now these are truly drive in movies this is what you saw in the 70zs drive inns and they are good movies every one of them kinda a funny looking back
Title: Roger Corman's Cult Classics: The Nurses Collection (Candy Stripe Nurses, Private Duty Nurses, Night Call Nurses, Young Nurses)

reviewText: A collection of Roger Cormans early work.  They are still funny and sexy and a look into history at the same time.  The sets and props are amazing to see from a period gone by.  Of course the acting and scripts are typical low budget Corman yet they are still fun to watch.
summary: Vintage Corman what more can I say!
Title: Roger Corman's Cult Classics: The Nurses Collection (Candy Stripe Nurses, Private Duty Nurses, Night Call Nurses, Young Nurses)

reviewText: These films are all about nurses who seduce their patients and have sex with them, but you don't see the real sex!  Roger Corman has edited out all the real sex and is trying to make money and not deliver the goods.  The films have been edited out and you can tell.  Very bad for the producers for when these films first came out, they included all the sex and it was acceptable then and now we are being short changed.  You better off finding people who have the original films on vhs and making copies from them.  The quality may not be so great but at least you will view the films in its entirety.
Title: Roger Corman's Cult Classics: The Nurses Collection (Candy Stripe Nurses, Private Duty Nurses, Night Call Nurses, Young Nurses)
